meanings.definition: Stums (verb): to silence or muffle a sound
meanings.sent1: She quickly stums her phone before the movie starts.
meanings.sent2: The librarian asked everyone to stums their voices in the library.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous students tried to stums their giggles during the serious assembly.
meanings.sent4: The thick curtains stums the noise from outside, creating a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The snowfall outside seemed to stums all other sounds, making the night eerily quiet.

meanings.definition: Stums (noun): a mixture of crushed grapes and stems during winemaking
meanings.sent1: The winemaker carefully added the stums to the fermentation tank.
meanings.sent2: The aroma of the stums filled the winery during the harvest season.
meanings.sent3: The chef used the stums to create a unique flavor in the new wine recipe.
meanings.sent4: The stums added a rich texture to the wine, enhancing its complexity.
meanings.sent5: The winery tour included a demonstration of how stums are used in winemaking.
